sentences.english: This film brought good luck for him, and he got more movie appointments, but he all refused.

sentences.english: It wouldn't be the first time government officials have rebuffed Xiang's overseas ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 這並非政府官員第一次回絕向文波的海外併購雄心。

sentences.english: Had not all the other places refused her because she did not know something or other?

sentences.english: Jia generation son hope LinZhenHai pass HuXiaoYue, has been rebuffed.

sentences.english: All rejected her, except Geneva Medical College in the state of New York.

sentences.english: Repeated rebuffs couldn't extinguish my enthusiasm.

definition: to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself

to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame

to interrupt/to break off/to break (a bone)
